sentences.en: A body bent forward, he didn't appear to use exertion or know weariness.
sentences.cn: 尽管身体向前弯着, 他并不显得费力,也毫无倦容.

sentences.en: Age diminishes the heart's ability to pump harder and faster under exertion.
sentences.cn: 随着年龄的增加，人在消耗体力时心脏的输血能力和输血速度会有所减弱。

sentences.en: Before settlement there was exertion, anxiety and need in human life.
sentences.cn: 在定居之前,人类的生活充满着劳累 、 焦虑和贫困.

sentences.en: By the end of the walk, she was breathless with exertion.
sentences.cn: 走到最后, 她累得上气不接下气.

sentences.en: Exertion of authority over others is not always wise.
sentences.cn: 以权压人并不总是明智的.

sentences.en: He clearly found the physical exertion exhilarating.
sentences.cn: 他明显感觉体力劳动令人愉快。

sentences.en: He finds tennis demanding too much exertion.
sentences.cn: 他发现打网球很费体力.

sentences.en: He meant to win golden opinions by meritorious exertion , by ingenious learning, by amiable compliance.
sentences.cn: 他想以富有成绩的努力, 真心诚意的求学, 使人喜爱的听话,博得黄金般的好评.

sentences.en: It's no exertion to him to lift the stone.
sentences.cn: 他不用费力就把那块石头举起来.

sentences.en: Nowadays I seem tired with the least exertion.
sentences.cn: 现在我好像稍一用力就感到疲劳.

sentences.en: She was hot and breathless from the exertion of cycling uphill.
sentences.cn: 她骑车上山累得全身发热，喘不过气来。

sentences.en: She was hot and breathless from the exertion of cycling uphill.
sentences.cn: 由于用力骑车爬坡, 她浑身发热,

sentences.en: The afternoon’s exertions had left us feeling exhausted.
sentences.cn: 下午太劳累了，我们感到精疲力竭。

sentences.en: There may be dyspnea after exertion.

sentences.cn: 尽量避免过度消耗体力.

sentences.en: We were sweating profusely from the exertion of moving the furniture.
sentences.cn: 我们搬动家具大费气力,累得大汗淋漓.

trans.tran_en: a lot of physical or mental effort
